title: The Glimmer-Crop Gospel
tagline: In a world selling salvation, the cure is dreaming of its own corruption.
themes: The Moral Rot of Virtuous Power

story: Write a scene where a 'green' tech CEO must give a tour of a 'Glimmer-crop' field to a group of terrified, yet financially beholden, farmers.
Draft the internal PR memo from the 'Heartland Harmony' campaign, spinning the glowing, pulsating crops as a feature, not a bug.
Create a monologue from the character of Emil Voss, explaining the concept of 'chemical memory' to a board of skeptical executives over a dinner of pre-industrial glacier ice.
Write a surrealist vignette from the perspective of the 'dreaming' synthetic topsoil itself, experiencing the memories of pollution it contains.
technical: Design a speculative data-visualization interface for Mara's data-slate, showing the 'sickle-moon' profit graph layered with real-time ecological feedback from the Glimmer-crops.
Conceptualize the architecture and interactive exhibits of the 'Carbon Museum,' where personal guilt is transformed into abstract, beautiful light shows.

council: Jeff VanderMeer (for the New Weird ecological surrealism)
Ursula K. Le Guin (for the anthropological study of power structures)
William Gibson (for the corporate noir and tech-poetic language)
Margaret Atwood (for the sharp dissection of moral compromise in a climate crisis)
